attributes.action: have speedway racing in the Olympic Stadium or in the Olympic Park
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Hackney Stadium in Waterden Road, Hackney, has long gone. Speedway racing was staged both post war and pre war in this stadium. The stadium was in the now massive Olympic Park, close to the new Olympic Stadium.  Speedway is a family sport. Fans travel all over the UK to follow their team.  Speedway in the Olympic Stadium or in an area within the Olympic Park would allow people from the length and breadth of Britain to use a legacy of the 2012 Olympic Games.  Let’s be able to use the fantastic amenities that will be available in or around the Olympic Stadium, for speedway fans to once again to be able to watch speedway and be able to say 
'Let’s make it a date, Friday at eight’
